website_summaries.verdict: The Strive 6 received a lot of positive feedback for its comfort and style. It was a recommended cross-training shoe because it was lightweight and had enough lateral support. The major issue people had with this model was its sewn-in tongue design.
pros: Based on general user feedback, the Under Armour Strive 6 was very light and comfortable to wear
According to fitness aficionados, the shoe worked well during gym workouts, treadmill and pavement runs and lifting weights
Many users liked that it was stylish for everyday use
The mesh upper was a welcome feature as it kept the foot ventilated
Some owners noted that it provided adequate lateral support
cons: Numerous people claimed that the sewn-in tongue made it harder to put on
A minority of owners complained that it started to fall apart with just a few weeks of use
Some buyers found the shoe to be too stiff

customer_reviews.title: They're good when you can get your feet into them.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are comfortable and they really give great support due to the design especially in the tongue, which is sewed together. At the same time, due to that very design, it's somewhat difficult to put the shoes on especially if one has wider feet. I use these mainly for cross-training workouts and they serve that purpose well. But I don't think I'd buy these again nor will I recommend them to people simply because how the tongues were sewed almost entire to the upper.
customer_reviews.author: Nichi

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe, however size and return policy is horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, but runs small. I normally wear size 11 and had to order a 12. Under Armour return policy is horrible. I returned some items 3 months ago and still haven't received my refund. I had to file a dispute with credit card company!
customer_reviews.author: GRD2326

customer_reviews.title: My husband's feet doesn't hurt anymore
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband, he said they were the most comfortable he's owned in years. He was driving me nuts complaining about the bottom of his feet hurting after standing for long periods, and I know he's not just being nice because he's worn them now for months and would definitely have forgotten and started complaining again. The size is correct/normal, and the quality/workmanship is high. Guess this will be the style/brand for him from now on...
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected, but a little tight.
customer_reviews.text: I love UA shoes and have several pairs. The Micro G are my favorite for casual wear. These fit as expected, but are a little tight across the bridge of the foot. Not enough for me to send them back, but if I was trying them on at the store along with another pair of UAs, I would probably have gone with the other pair.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Held up after a beating
customer_reviews.text: I love these workout shoes. I've used them in the gym, on deployment, and they've held up nicely over time. They're not as torn up other gym shoes that I've had for a shorter amount of time. The fit was fine and has more cushion than others. Under armour makes a very good shoe and boots to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Brownbear

customer_reviews.title: Good but They Run Small
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great but be aware that they run small. Reading the other reviews, I went a half size bigger when I ordered and it still wasn't enough. I had to return those for a full size larger. But once those arrived the fit was fantastic. They support well and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: runs small. but good shoe
customer_reviews.text: overall good value and comfortable. Ankle support is good. I'm a size 9 1/2 and bought the 10. I should have returned it for the better size, these run a little small. Would have been better with 10 1/2
customer_reviews.author: American

customer_reviews.title: Great.  Order one size up
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size up. I am a female that tends to prefer men style in athletic footwear. I love the wideness in the toe area. I generally wear 8.5 or 9 in Mens, but when I tried them on in the store 9 was too tight! The store was out of size 10. Amazon had the right size for a better price. Love my shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Way to small
customer_reviews.text: I gave the shoes 2 stars only because they were to small. I'm a size 12 so that's what I got and I could hardly get my foot into them. I ended up giving them to my dad who is a 10-10 1/2 and he said they fit good with just enough room for his feet. Not sure if he wears them but when he put them on he said they felt great. If they were 12 like it says I'm sure they would have worked perfect for me but they were way to small for a size 12.
customer_reviews.author: dustin

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for running and daily use
customer_reviews.text: I love Under Armour's Strive running shoes. This particular line of shoes is comfortable, durable and work well whether I am running or just walking around during my daily life. These Strive 6 shoes are no different. They did fit me a little small, but they are fully broken by now. Great shoes for physically active people.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Ambriz

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I will always boast about under armour shoea. I stand on concrete all day in a warehouse and i wear nothing but mens under armour shoes. Great durability, great quality, great support.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah!

customer_reviews.title: These shoes really stand up!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 10 and really hard on shoes. He's had these for about four months now and even though they're white, they still look fantastic. And that's after a basketball season, muddy playgrounds, lacrosse practice and even swimming in a creek with them on! Under Armour just makes quality stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Badmackdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe well made but somehow underarmor you are ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe well made but somehow underarmor you are not checking your shoe to see if size are true I another pair same brand different color although I wear 9.5 I had to get a size 10 I did the same with the black and they are just abit smaller then the other color that way you get 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: Tiger wu

customer_reviews.title: Strive series are way better than the current Micro G Pulse series
customer_reviews.text: I used to only buy the Micro G Pulse series of shoes but the later models seem to have overly soft arch support which can force your feet to under-pronate. The Strive series so far is much better. The support all around is perfect for me and I have a wider foot than the average person. These are the best indoor gym shoes I've had so far.
customer_reviews.author: James Davis

customer_reviews.title: The fit is pretty good and I can see if you were to ...
customer_reviews.text: Not for big people. I'm 6'1", 300 lbs and after about 2 weeks of using these to work out with heavy weights, they feel that the bottom of the shoe gave out a bit. More stress on the foot than other brands. The fit is pretty good and I can see if you were to wear them as an every day shoe to walk around how they would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. The 4E were a perfect fit in size 12. I normally wear 13 I. UA to make sure my wide feet aren't too smashed. While not a true minimalist shoe, they're pretty similar and good for my workouts *****My wife was so impressed that she bought these in the same size as her metcon 2 and says they are much roomier
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small and Narrow
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased a pair of under armour shoes a few years ago and liked them, so I was hoping to order a replacement pair for him. However, the sizing seems to have changed; they are smaller and more narrow than they used to be. I have ordered two different sizes in two different styles trying to find the right fit, and they were too small and uncomfortable. Will be returning them and going to a shoe store.
customer_reviews.author: simms

customer_reviews.title: Nice sneakers, my kid loves them
customer_reviews.text: Nice sneakers, my kid loves them. Ordered them for me....but these fit at least a 1/2 size smaller than the size they are labeled. I usually wear size 10, which actually gives me a little toe wiggle room. These Under Armour size 10 fit like a snug size 9.5
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Horton

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, sized smaller than normal
customer_reviews.text: If you wear nike, then these are sized very, very similar. I wear a 13 Mens in Nike, and a 12 in everything else. Instead of sending back, I decided to donate to Goodwill and I'll reorder a 13 soon.
customer_reviews.author: T.C.

customer_reviews.title: Gave me blisters quickly.  Should have gone with Nike
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that these fit so poorly. Initially seemed okay, but after wearing more than a couple of hours I started getting blisters, and so I didn't take them with me to Europe. I got back and wanted to return or exchange them, and I waited too long and now I am stuck with shoes that hurt. :(
customer_reviews.author: Neal Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Wears good, hard to get on & off.
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear 9 1/2 or maybe 10 shoe, so I bought 10 1/2 & it is barely large enough, toes touch the end. I would have given the shoe a 5 star if the tongue had not been sewn in. With a high arch it is almost impossible to get on or off. The shoe looks good & wears good.
customer_reviews.author: Jim \Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: the opening for the foot is too small. thought there would be a tongue to open it up but it is sewn together so cant open it up bigger. smaller then I thought for an extra extra wide shoe. I am having a hard time finding extra wide shoes. disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Workout/GYM sneakers
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers exceeded my expectation. Very good all around workout sneaker immediately noticed I could firmly plant my feet while lifting and comfortable enough for cardio equipment
customer_reviews.author: DevilDog

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Shoes, Small Fit at Larger Sizes
customer_reviews.text: These are beautiful shoes and very light. Perfect for training activities. However they do fit on the small side. I still plan to keep them and wear without socks as I believe they will loosen up. But if I was to buy them again I might go up one size. Although going to 14 from 13 might make them too big.
customer_reviews.author: RonnieW

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: First the pro's. The sneaker looks great and has a snug fit. They are lighter compared to other training sneakers I've purchased before. Overall, I'm happy with the purchase HOWEVER, the sneakers sent to me were clearly not new as advertised. They came laced and there was visible dirt in the treads. This was disappointing since I spent a lot of time making a decision on which sneaker to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well I learn a lesson on this one.. ...
customer_reviews.text: Well I learn a lesson on this one .. don't order shoes you can't try on .. I wear a 81/2.. I order a 9.. my daughter is wearing them and she wears a 71/2.. you figure ..
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hochstetter

customer_reviews.title: Best work out clothing line
customer_reviews.text: Always get under armour for the gym. Best work out clothing line. Nike sucks and over priced. The sneaks are extremely comfortable and really dont want to take them off. Lol.

customer_reviews.text: My husband likes them. They are comfortable but will order a whole size larger the next time as they run small. He usually wears a 10.5, I bought an 11 next time I'll buy 11.5.

I was born with ridiculous wide duck feet and are normally cursed with sweet wide white new balance shoes that I'm sure you've all seen dads wear around disney world. Shoes fit great. I love them. I almost look less like a dad now....

Today is April 29th, 67 days besides that I didn't worn them everyday because I love UnderArmour products and have four different models of them. This one, didn't like them that much. I rate 1 star for the name but the quality if this product didn't do so well. Front pealed off doing nothing special, worn them everyday walk and at work (walking as Sales Specialist on floor at the one of the stores for plumbing).

customer_reviews.text: They were half a size too small, sent back with exchange form for a size 11 but got an email stating they were refunded. Would still like same shoe in a size 11 please.

customer_reviews.text: Shoes are absolutely garbage. The soles are black and green after a week the black reveled green as it started to fade. In addition there are numerous threads fraying on the outers of the shoe. Complete trash. We had been happy with UA sneakers in the past, but these are simply trash.

customer_reviews.text: I was and am a New Balance guy. 12 - 4E. These shoes are INCREDIBLE for my Fred Flintsone feet! Not stuck w NB forever.

customer_reviews.text: The lip of the show under the laces dose not lift up all the way. So putting these sneakers on without a shoe horn is difficult & time consuming. I wouldn't buy this style again.

customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great, but I normally wear a size 10 wide or 10.5 regular. I ordered the 10.5 and they are wide enough but are shorter in length than a size 10

customer_reviews.text: These were supposed to be 4E, which is extra wide. They weren't even close. I had to return them.

So I already knew what size to get. They do run pretty small, so I’d get a full size larger than what you normally wear. As far as quality, durability, comfort, etc., they’re great shoes. I stand all day at work, and these are the most comfortable shoes I’ve found so far. 5 stars, just remember to size up when you order.

product_meta.title: Under Armour Men's Strive 6 Training Shoes Cross Trainer
product_meta.description: Breathable mesh upper with leather midsole lockdown for support & stability. Internal TPU heel counter for locked in support. Rubber toe wrap. Dual-density Micro Gfoam gives you added cushioning where you need it & durability where you need that. Rubber outsole delivers multidirectional traction.
